monogr.title: The vvhole Psalter translated into English metre, which contayneth an hundreth and fifty Psalmes. The first quinquagene

lg.head: Paule. Ephe. 5. Col. 3.
lg.l: SYng Psalmes and hymnes: and songes on hye,
To God your selues among:
But sing in hart: make melodye,
To God geue thankes in song.

lg.head: Iames. V.
lg.l: IF sad ye be: and beare the crosse,
In faith pray ye contrite:
If glad ye be: and feele no losse,
Sing Psalmes of thankes aright.

lg.head: Dauid. Psalme. 33.47.68.
lg.l: IN Lute and Harpe: reioyce to sing,
Syng Psalmes in decachorde:
Of all the earth: sith God is Kyng,
Syng wisely feare the Lorde.

lg.head: Iesus Syrach. 44.
lg.l: THe fathers olde: both sought and found,
Sweete musikes moodes full fine:
The Scripture songes: they did expound,
Their hartes were all deuine.

lg.head: Iesus Syrach. 32.
lg.l: WHo knowledge loueth: teach him thy lore,
No musike hinder thou:
Where hearyng wanth: spare wordes the more,
And modestie allow.
